description: This notification is generated when the LSP is found
not in the defect state at the LSP ingress.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrLSPOutDefect HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrIndex u 9999 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrTunnName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrAvaState i 0 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrDefectType i 0

description: This is a unique index for an OAM ingress entry in the OAM table.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrIndex

description: The name of a tunnel.
For ingress, it means the tunnel name of the detected LSP.
For egress, it means the tunnel name of the reverse LSP.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrTunnName

description: If the LSP Timer (T1) expires, then the LSP enters the
Unavailable state. The start point of the Unavailable state
is deemed to be at the entry into the LSP defect state.
An LSP re-enters the Available state after the LSP Defect state
exists first.
T1 defines the length of time the LSP is in the Defect state
before declaring an LSP Unavailable or returning to defect
free state.
0: available state;
1: unavailable state.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrAvaState

description: Defect is defined as interruption of the capability of a
transport entity (e.g., network connection) to transfer user
or OAM information. There are six types of defect:
0: no defect;
1: dServer;
2: dPeerMe;
3: dLOCV, Loss of Connectivity Verification defect;
4: dTTSI-Mismatch, Trail Termination Source Identifier Mismatch defect;
5: dTTSI-Mismerge, Trail Termination Source Identifier Mismerge defect;
6: dExcess, Receiving excess rate of CV/FFD;
7: dUnknown, Unknown defect in the MPLS network..
8: rlsn down;
9: dIngressDown.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamIgrDefectType

description: This notification is generated when the LSP is found
in the defect state at the LSP ingress.

event.Summary: MPLS LSP ingress in defect state

description: If autoprotocol is enabled, this notification is generated when
egress receives the first CV/FFD packet.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrFirstPkt HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLspName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLsrId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrSessTunnId i 9999 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrDetType i 0 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrDetFreq i 0

description: The object indicates the name of static LSP at egress.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLspName

description: The object indicates the Ingress LSR ID of the LSP.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLsrId

description: The object indicates the the Ingress session tunnel ID of the LSP..
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrSessTunnId

description: 0: invalid, if auto-protocol, this detect type is invalid;
1: CV;
2: FFD.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrDetType

description: 0: 1000ms(only for cv);
7: invalid;
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrDetFreq

description: The FDI packet is used by the upstream node in an LSP
to inform the egress of the defect information.
It is also generated when the auto protocol is enabled,
with which the LSP ingress notifies the egress to stop
the OAM detection.

Summary.eval: ($v4==0) ? 'Auto protocol disabled with LSP' : 'Auto protocol enabled with LSP'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrAutoProFDI HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLspName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLsrId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrSessTunnId i 9999 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrEnable i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrAutoProFDI HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLspName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLsrId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrSessTunnId i 9999 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrEnable i 0

description: The object indicates the name of static LSP at egress.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLspName

description: The object indicates the Ingress LSR ID of the LSP.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrLsrId

description: The object indicates the the Ingress session tunnel ID of the LSP..
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrSessTunnId

description: Whether one LSP is enabled with OAM.
If disable, LSP is not monitored;
If enable, CV/FFD is generated at the source LSR of the LSP and
checked at the sink LSR of the LSP, and user can set
other configuration.
0: The OAM function is disabled on the egress;
1: The OAM function is enabled on the egress.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrEnable

description: This notification is generated when the Rlsn is down.

Summary.eval: ($v3==1) ? 'Egress RLSN is up' : 'Egress RLSN is down'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrRlsnDown HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnLspName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnLsrId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnIsDown i 2 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnIfName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnSessTunnId i 9999

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamEgrRlsnDown HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnLspName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnLsrId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnIsDown i 1 HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnIfName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnSessTunnId i 9999

description: For egress, the object indicates name of the LSP.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnLspName

description: For egress, the object indicates the Ingress LSR ID of the LSP
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnLsrId

description: 1: up
2: down
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnIsDown

description: The object indicates the name of outbound interface.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnIfName

description: For egress, the object indicates the Ingress session tunnel ID
of the LSP
variables.name: HUAWEI-MPLSOAM-MIB::hwMplsOamRlsnSessTunnId
